TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit Notification/Builder extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Builder class for objects.
Docs.remarks:
Provides a convenient way to set the various fields of a and generate content views using the platform's notification layout template. If your app supports versions of Android as old as API level 4, you can instead use , available in the Android Support library.
[Android Documentation]

A indicating how to handle

The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Notification.Builder AddAction (Android.App.Notification.Action action);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder AddAction(class Android.App.Notification/Action action) cil managed

Docs.param: The action to add.
Docs.summary: Add an action to this notification.

remarks.para: Actions are typically displayed by the system as a button adjacent to the notification content. Every action must have an icon, a textual label, and a . A notification in its expanded form can display up to three actions, from left to right in the order they were added. Actions will not be displayed when the notification is collapsed, however, so be sure that any essential functions may be accessed by the user in some other way (for example, in the Activity pointed to by ).

to be fired when the action is invoked.
Docs.summary: Add an action (with a corresponding title and intent) to this notification.
Docs.remarks:
Actions are typically displayed by the system as a button adjacent to the notification content.
A notification displays up to three actions, from left to right in the order they were added.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Notification.Builder AddPerson (string uri);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder AddPerson(string uri) cil managed

Docs.param: A URI for the person.
Docs.summary: Add a person that is relevant to this notification.

remarks.para: Depending on user preferences, this annotation may allow the notification to pass through interruption filters, and to appear more prominently in the user interface. The person should be specified by the String representation of a . The system will also attempt to resolve mailto: and tel: schema URIs. The path part of these URIs must exist in the contacts database, in the appropriate column, or the reference will be discarded as invalid. Telephone schema URIs will be resolved by .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Notification.Builder SetFullScreenIntent (Android.App.PendingIntent intent, bool highPriority);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder SetFullScreenIntent(class Android.App.PendingIntent intent, bool highPriority) cil managed

Docs.param: The pending intent to launch.
Passing true will cause this notification to be sent even if other notifications are suppressed.
Docs.summary: Specifies an intent to launch instead of posting the notification to the status bar.
Docs.remarks:
Only for use with extremely high-priority notifications demanding the user's immediate attention, such as an incoming phone call or alarm clock that the user has explicitly set to a particular time. If this facility is used for something else, please give the user an option to turn it off and use a normal notification, as this can be extremely disruptive.
[Android Documentation]

Docs.param: The group key of the group.
Docs.summary: Set this notification to be part of a group of notifications sharing the same key.
Docs.remarks: Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering. To make this notification the summary for its group, also call . A sort order can be specified for group members by using .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Notification.Builder SetOngoing (bool ongoing);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder SetOngoing(bool ongoing) cil managed

Docs.param: If set to true, the notification will be an ongoing notification.
Docs.summary: Set whether this is an "ongoing" notification.
Docs.remarks:
Ongoing notifications cannot be dismissed by the user, so your application or service must take care of canceling them. They are typically used to indicate a background task that the user is actively engaged with (e.g., playing music) or is pending in some way and therefore occupying the device (e.g., a file download, sync operation, active network connection).
[Android Documentation]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Notification.Builder SetSortKey (string sortKey);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder SetSortKey(string sortKey) cil managed

Docs.param: The sort key for the notification.
Docs.summary: Set a sort key that orders this notification among other notifications from the same package.
Docs.remarks: This can be useful if an external sort was already applied and an app would like to preserve this. Notifications will be sorted lexicographically using this value, although providing different priorities in addition to providing sort key may cause this value to be ignored. This sort key can also be used to order members of a notification group. See .

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Notification/Builder SetUsesChronometer(bool b) cil managed

Docs.param: If set to true, uses the chronometer; else, shows a timestamp.
Docs.summary: Show the field as a stopwatch.
Docs.remarks:
Instead of presenting when as a timestamp, the notification will show an automatically updating display of the minutes and seconds since when. Useful when showing an elapsed time (like an ongoing phone call).
[Android Documentation]

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
